trans-unit.source: Provides a control that can perform custom validation against another control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This class behaves identically to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator?displayProperty=fullName> Web server control.
Developers can choose their own common language runtime delegate to use for validation.
By default, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls on a form raise validator events on the form to perform validation when the form is submitted to the server.
To disable automatic validation, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command.CausesValidation%2A> property on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls to `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.CustomValidator"></xref> class.
Determines whether the properties to be validated are valid.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if control properties to be validated are valid; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Virtual method for derived class to create its own aggregated Web validator.
The Web validator is for getting and setting of the common properties of Web base validator.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
An aggregated Web validator.
Called during the validation stage when ASP.NET processes a Mobile Web Form.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the validator is valid, otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate"></xref> event.
The value to validate.
if the value specified by the value parameter passes validation; otherwise, .
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.CustomValidator"></xref> validates the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ControlToValidate*> property.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
If a method is registered with this event, it is called with the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.BaseValidator.ControlToValidate%2A> property.
Validation succeeds only if this event handler returns `true`.
To be added.
